meanings.sent1: After the war, the reoccupation of the city brought back a sense of normalcy.
meanings.sent2: The reoccupation of the abandoned house was a welcome sight for the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The reoccupation of the last slice of cake sparked a playful food fight.
meanings.sent4: Her reoccupation of the top spot in the competition surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The reoccupation of the park by families on weekends made it a lively place.

meanings.definition: The state of being occupied again.
meanings.sent1: The reoccupation of the office building after renovations was met with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The reoccupation of the classroom by students signaled the start of the new semester.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected reoccupation of the swing set by adults caused laughter among the children.
meanings.sent4: His mind's reoccupation with the past hindered his ability to focus on the present.
meanings.sent5: The reoccupation of the beach by seagulls created a lively atmosphere by the shore.
